title: All these complaints about Crits, Yasuo, Graves, etc etc
body:
All of these were brought to the attention of Riot when the preseaon hit the PBE.

But of course riot completely ignored the feedback given to them and went along with it anyway. And now we have this chaos.

#PBEServerhowdoesitwork?.

When I got my PBE account I was happy, thrilled even, I thought maybe with a PBE account I could finally have a voice. I could finally help  With bugs and help Riot understand what is game breaking and what isn't. I wanted to use my PBE account to help stop things like this, the pre season backlash from happening.

But even on the PBE the voices and opinions of the people go ignored. So I really don't know what to think or say. I feel like I have failed as a PBE Tester, But when can I honestly do when my voice is being silenced or drown out by a stubborn employer.

There is nothing I can do.

The game took a slow 180 at mid season 4, its just gone downhill very slowly and now its began to speed up A LOT.
Its not just been this recent patch that really made everyone mad. It been a build up over along time ever since the end of season.
season 3

I agree. We used to see Riot talk about Clarity, Balance and Not Losing in Champ Select. We were told they were aware of power spikes and doing their best to even them out (In particular, I remember them flipping the #s on Renekton's Ultimate, making it weaker early and stronger late). I thought things like Fiora, Mordekaiser and Darius were going to be something Riot would be more active in combating in the future. But they remain extremely strong.

I hate the new masteries. They seem to lack clarity in some regards and aren't balanced. While the old system was neatly labeled (Off, Def, Util) the new system has often left me wondering where the hell im supposed to place things on the champ im playing. Also, the old system was full of slight buffs and minor passive boosts. This new system sees massive bonuses and very strong active abilities. The new system is going to be harder than hell to balance.

But, I'm also not impressed with Riot's ability to balance and fix things of late. Fiora, Mord (and in soloqueue, Darius) are still hell to play against. They've been so for a couple of months. It's Pre-Season, but it's still a patch, I was hoping to see a few things fixed, not more gasoline thrown on a fire.

S4 Mastery trees were actually fine, and I finally had great pages for all three major roles (ADC/Mid/Tank)

Now I have to go back to trial-and-error games with trees that make no sense

Yea its fine to shorten game time, or make a game faster pace, but they are completely ignoring how they are gimping half the cast in the process... but then again, they couldn't even be bothered to update champs when they reduce the start time for games. Before season 4, comebacks were still a possibility, champions still had an option to scale. This minion change is the NOT way to go about it, it takes any lead and snowballs it out of control. The game will be decided in the first 5 minutes and the next 15 minutes will be watching one team get further and further ahead untill they finally decide to kill the base.

Common complaints on the PBE server included:

- Yasuo is almost completely broken now
- Morellonomicon can't compete with executioner's calling on any level anymore
- Assassin junglers have a really hard time with their first clear.
- Junglers in general are hurting for gold and their items (especially runeglaive) are super expensive.



Didn't see much acknowledgement on any of these things, honestly.  I mean, I'm sure they KNOW, but I can't see how at least Yasuo didn't get some changes before shipping.

You cannot judge balance on the pbe because the average pbe player is low silver at best. Everything looks OP there at one point or another because the skill disparity in every single game is enormous.

Except Yasuo, he will skyrocket and probably get gutted.

I'm honestly not convinced he's that much stronger. The extra crit and the crit healing mastery are extremely nice but the significantly lower amount of AD in the game hurts him significantly and he doesn't snowball as hard when ahead since Shiv is weaker until lvl 12 and despite the higher level of crit, his Shiv IE powerspike is significantly weaker.

The extra crit and the crit healing mastery are extremely nice but the significantly lower amount of AD in the game hurts him significantly and he doesn't snowball as hard when ahead since Shiv is weaker until lvl 12 and despite the higher level of crit, his Shiv IE powerspike is significantly weaker.

99% of people think he's borderline op now, on the other side there's you saying he is ok. The ad reduction actually didn't hurt because he can itemize now much easier, a lot easier than any other class, people are complaining about adcs getting items, meanwhile the actual truth is these items were made for yasuo, as if they just made them for him, also the general ad reduction which doesn't exist because it affects every ad oriented champ. Just admit it he got too strong with his passive, he can build static shiv and the cloak to get 100% crit chance.

Half the community thought he was still OP when he had a 42% win rate in 4.18 and that he needed even more nerfs. This community doesn't know shit. And of course the general AD reduction means something. Yasuo is a champion entirely reliant on multiplicative scaling which means that if you nerf any part of the equation, he gets hurt substantially. Every point of AD is effectively worth 2.25 AD for Yasuo since he crits every hit once he has IE. -15 from IE is -34 damage per auto and Q just from that change alone. Shiv is actually weaker until lvl 12, making a Yasuo that get's early kills less snowbally. Yasuo's healing from the crit mastery, as much as people like to complain about it, does absolutely nothing for him until after the first back and doesn't even heal that much until he has IE, at which point the laning phase is usually over and 15% LS every 2 seconds is not nearly as beneficial.

I honestly don't know why I bother typing these out. They just get downvoted by a bunch of salty people who, to this day, still don't know how to play against a Yasuo, feed him early, and then come here and complain about how OP he is when he's 1v3ing them after he's already 5/0.
You do know Meddler just said "Early indications suggest Yasuo's too dominant in 5.22. " 8 hours ago....
Your point seems fine, even if it's just an opinion, yet people are downvoting your posts into oblivion as if you're being a troll, an asshole, or intentionally being duplicitous.... I don't get it.

That's just what you get for defending unpopular champions. I get the same shit when I dare to defend Thresh, Lee, and Riven too. The voice of reason cannot hope to stand against hate boners of such magnitude.

Yasuo never needed to build IE to get 100% crit chance. Its just that it also gave a bunch of other stats that he likes. 50% more crit damage and AD. He could just as well have bought anything else and got similar stats. But it would have been inefficient to do so.

The only thing that has actually changed for Yasuo is the masteries.
